data.description:
This is an attempt to create the reference of time normally associated with a spinning dial but adjusted for a low resulotion screen.

This is similar to many other ruler watch faces in which the time slides from right to left.  The difference is I bold the current time which happens when the text is centered over the red indicator line.  By doing so there are no additional tick lines illustrating start/end/half/quarter points.

It takes a while to get used to as some people feel that the watch is showing the next hour/day/date/month because it is closer to red line.  However if you keep your eye to left of screen and focus on bold text you can then quickly see how close the current time is to changing.

Also added new font for status bar to add readability.  There is no battery level or bluetooth indicator, however if this gets a lot of hearts I will add these features and release source code.

Hope you enjoy seeing time slide...

Link to black background version:
https://apps.getpebble.com/applications/55c0ef42bb5a5b0640000068
24hr version
https://apps.getpebble.com/applications/55c15f34a736657ffd00007a

latest_release.release_notes: Now also works on Pebble, Pebble Steel

data.title: Time Slide

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: sharp, futuristic numbers
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

Sharp's numbers are all based on a checkbox with an x in it (☒). That alone wasn't satisfying so I sketched around and came up with the futuristic style you see now. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

data.author: Sam Jerichow

changelog.release_notes: The 12th hour needed to be fixed. It is █ █ ││now.

data.description:
Summary: a readable barcode
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 06:25, 08:47PM, 12:59PM

I was experimenting with a barcode time that's actually readable. I kept it a little cryptic, which is the essential aesthetic of a barcode, next to the minimalistic style. I also decided to leave numbers away, that would have degraded the code to mere decoration. But you don't need numbers. 

All you need to know is that the thin bar │ is a 1 and the thick bar █ is a 5.
So the thin bars count up to 4 and the thick bars up to 2, which is a 10. So a 6 for example is a thick and a thin bar. There are four sections, that are divided by a thick gap to minimize confusion, while in each section the bars are separated by thin gaps to keep a visual relationship. Left you have the hours, in the middle are 10 minute increments and on the right are the remaining minutes. On the far right is the PM indicator for relevant times. 

The Pebble Time version has a gradient, giving the whole code a smoother appearance. It's not only looking cool but also goes better with the round case.

Design : Sam Jerichow Programming : Sam Jerichow
Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: The 12th hour needed to be fixed. It is █ █ ││now.

data.title: Horologicode

data.author: dezign999

changelog.release_notes: initial release

data.description:
#watchfacewednesday

A simple watch face that will load your external jpg image onto your pebble. Use the settings page to add your image url, all image conversion is done on your phone for added privacy.

Notes:
Its best to use links to small images for greater reliability and speed. Dropbox share links are supported, and will automatically extract the direct image link.

This watch face uses portions of Gregoire Sage's incredible Image Viewer app. Thank You!

Features
• Load Your Own JPG
• Flick for Time and Date
• Configurable Hourly Vibration
• Dynamic Image Resizing and Positioning
• Configurable Border (Black/White)
• Configurable Time Panel (Normal/Inverse)
• Dropbox share link compatible

latest_release.release_notes: initial release

data.title: imageWatch999

data.author: Watson Tungjunyatham
data.description:
Love me, seriously!

This is a Maji de Watashi ni Koishinasai! (Majikoi) themed watchface, with a few other features as well! This watchface includes 5 backgrounds and 11 characters that randomly shuffle upon loading the app. There is also an icon that indicates the day of the week based off the Japanese kanji character. Now Miyako can watch you everywhere you go!

CHARACTERS: Momoyo, Kazuko, Miyako, Yukie, Chris, Shouichi, Gakuto, Moro, Tadakatsu, Touma, Kokoro

BACKGROUNDS: Yamato's Room, Class 2-F, Secret Base, Kawakami Temple, Agave Field

Future versions will include a rotating character per hour and possible integration on the Pebble Time platform!
data.title: Maji de Watashi ni Koishinasai! W (Majikoi! W)

data.description:
Classic, yet elegant, watchface for Pebble Time. Redone to fit Time as well as the classic Pebble. Hidden battery status and BT connection indicator in the nine-marker. When BT connection drops, the nine-marker turns red with a subtle (optional) vibration. Hands presence, order and color is configurable (minutes or hour on top). 

This is a paid watchface. Price $1,99. 2 Days free trial included.

data.description:
Would you like to match your Nike shoes colors with your Pebble Time watchface? Just do it, with NIKE pAIR. 

You can also pair other sneaker brands, T-shirts, clothes, and so on, using the "Universal pair" theme.

  
+ WEATHER TEMPERATURE UNIT
  - Celsius
  - Fahrenheit
  - Kelvin
  
+ VIBES ON DISCONNECT
  - Vibes or not when bluetooth Pebble connection is lost.
  
+ SHOW BATTERY BAR
  - Show or hide a bar showing the battery level.

+ DATE STYLE
  - No date
  - Day DAYWEEK  (eg. 23 MON)
  - Day only  (eg. 23)

+ COLOR HEIGHT DISTRIBUTION
  - 60% Upper / 40% Midsole
  - 50% Upper / 50% Sole
  - 40% Tongue / 60% Upper
  
+ CUSTOM TOP COLOR
  - Choose from 17 colors
  - Random color
  
+ CUSTOM BOTTOM COLOR
  - Choose from 17 colors
  - Random color
  
+ CUSTOM SWOOSH COLOR
  - Choose from 17 colors
  - Random color
  
+ PAIR THEME
  - NIKE pAIR
  - Universal pair (no logo)
  
+ RANDOM FREQUENCY 

+ WEATHER LOCATION
  - Blank for auto detection.
  - ZipCode,CountryCode for fixed manual location.

latest_release.release_notes:
1.1 
- settings page host changed
- bug fixed: date style ignored

data.title: NIKE pAIR

data.description:
Kiezel Watchfaces | Off Center

This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

Modern and classy analog face for the professional look.

Customize the background color, hour hand color, minute hand color, hour tick marks color, and the center circle color.

Options to toggle invert colors when bluetooth disconnects and vibrate on bluetooth disconnect.

NOTE: Colors can only be changed on the Pebble Time watch, not the original Pebble and Pebble Steel.

data.author: JF Messier

changelog.release_notes: First release of a very (!) simple Hexadecimal Clock. It displays hours, minutes and seconds in hexadecimal, using computer-like font to make it very geek-like. No options, menu, or changes to the display. Very simple. But everyone will ask you: "What is this?". Simply tell them this is for those who can understand Hexadecimal, the real geeks. Current release is for the Pebble Time only.

data.description: This is the simplest Hexadecimal clock. No configuration options. Very first option. It displays the digits in a geeky typeface, and the hours, minutes and seconds are displayed at different positions to better read them.

latest_release.release_notes: First release of a very (!) simple Hexadecimal Clock. It displays hours, minutes and seconds in hexadecimal, using computer-like font to make it very geek-like. No options, menu, or changes to the display. Very simple. But everyone will ask you: "What is this?". Simply tell them this is for those who can understand Hexadecimal, the real geeks. Current release is for the Pebble Time only.

data.description: The DigTap watchface is simple and elegant. With a tag of your wrist you will get more informations for 5 seconds. In the corners you see the bluetooth connection state, either the week of year or a second timezone (adjustable in the settings), the battery state and the date. You can choose colors for background, info, hour and minute digits. You are able to avoid backlight or you decide backlight appears on a single or double tap of your wrist.

latest_release.release_notes: New backlight mode; choose colors for background, info, hour and minute digits.

data.description:
In printed text, a bullet refers to a heavy dot. In this watchface, bullets will show you the time and your battery level.

- A different colored bullet for every digit.
- Toggle between 12 and 24 hour time.
- Optional battery indicator and date display.

data.author: Starthief
data.description:
Analog watch that shows time in the style of a radar screen.

The circle is divided into 12 segments, representing hours.  The current minutes can be read by the position of the radar blip near the outer edge, and also in the amount of the next segment that is filled in.  In the screenshot below the time is 9:25.

data.description:
This is a Pebble Time exclusive watchface designed after the Star Fox LCD game watches developed by Nintendo and Nelsonic in 1993. Now you can experience this watch again without eating two boxes of cereal for it!

You can read more about Nelsonic's line of game watches here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nelsonic_Industries

The time is displayed at the top. The bar under "SHIELD" is a measure of your Pebble Time's battery.

**This is a novelty watch face only. You can not play the game.**

latest_release.release_notes: - Fixed mountains on aplite

data.description: An internationally friendly watchface that's clean and easy to read. The watchface displays date in ISO 8601 standard format, time, am/pm, and your local temperature (Celsius & Fahrenheit) if connected to Bluetooth.

latest_release.release_notes: When setting is 24h time, am/pm isn't displayed.

data.title: Boxy Occasion

data.author: Lex Dreitser
data.description:
This product is inspired by recent college student deaths from caffeine and other stimulants. It's also inspired by the '94 film Speed where a city bus needs to stay above 50 mph.

I created a standalone pebble watch face that keeps the user awake without the use of stimulants. It monitors the pebble's accelerometer - if the wearer stops moving (falls asleep) - the watch will vibrate and light up to wake the user. 
The watch face displays inspirational quotes, along with the time and a convenient battery meter.
data.title: NO SLEEP WATCH

data.author: Mike Austin

changelog.release_notes: Add support for Pebble Time Round and provide option for two-hand mode.

* Noon time now displays 12 for the hour
* Added dial animation for minute changes
* Added battery and bluetooth status icons
Initial release

data.description:
UPDATE - Version 1.2 with these features:
* Added support for Pebble Time Round
* Added option to display two hands, which works more like a regular clock

UPDATE - Version 1.1 with these features:
* Noon time now displays 12 for the hour
* Added dial animation for minute changes
* Added battery and bluetooth status icons

This is a watch face that simulates a sports car tachometer. The first MPH/KPH digits show the hour, while the last show minutes / 6. The dial shows the minuts (x10). Speed units can be changed by going to Settings > DATE & TIME > Time Format and changing to 12h or 24h format. Please send feedback to mike_ekim@yahoo.com so I can improve it and add more features! Enjoy!

latest_release.release_notes: Add support for Pebble Time Round and provide option for two-hand mode.

data.title: RPM

data.description:
A simple watchface with three rings. Seconds is the outer (orange) ring, minutes is the middle (blue) ring and hours is the center (black) ring. 
The weather and date is also displayed in the middle. Date is displayed in the dd/mm format.

latest_release.release_notes: This is the initial release of the Doughnut watchface by Swapnull

data.description: Represents the time as a sine wave, with midnight at the bottom of the curve, noon at the top, and zero crossings at 6AM and 6PM.  Colors switch between day and night settings according to sunrise/sunset times from openweathermap.org.  Also shows date, battery status and current temperature.

data.author: Starthief

changelog.release_notes:
Updated to work (hopefully) with SDK 4.0+.  

The display is slightly different in this version since I had to abandon one of the processing stages to work around what's either a new firmware bug or undocumented limitation.

data.description:
A hybrid (analog+digital) watchface with a glitch art/cyberpunk aesthetic. Only updates once per minute to conserve battery life, though constant animation might be awesome... 

The central ring is the hour, outer ring is minutes.  A narrow stripe on the right edge serves as a color-coded battery meter.  The current date is encoded in the text along the top: a single letter for the day of week (suNday, Monday, tUesday, Wednesday, tHursday, Friday, sAturday), the day of the month, the pointer address of the GContext in lowercase, and the month in upper case with the first character shifted.  In these screenshots it's Friday, July 24.

latest_release.release_notes:
Updated to work (hopefully) with SDK 4.0+.  

The display is slightly different in this version since I had to abandon one of the processing stages to work around what's either a new firmware bug or undocumented limitation.

data.description:
Fuzzy Time with languages supported by Pebble : 
English, Spanish, German, French

Also supports colors for Pebble Time.

settings :
- change background (dark or light)
- text alignment
- 12h/24h for digital hour (Pebble setting)

If you like it, click on the heart !
I am not speaking all these languages, so it may have mistakes.
Do not hesitate to report problems or submit evolution. 

Fuzzy time, updates every 5 minutes
- animation at every time text change
- current digital time in the top part
- current date in the bottom part
- bluetooth connection indicator in upper left part.
- current battery level in right upper part, with charging indicator


This face is inspired from http://www.mypebblefaces.com/apps/14715/8406

latest_release.release_notes: minor layout change

data.author: Sam Jerichow

changelog.release_notes: Repeating numbers are not coloured the same way anymore.

data.description:
Summary: dots, dots, dooots
Readability: easy
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

Chroma is inspired by colour blind test patterns invented by Dr. Shinobu Ishihara in 1917. Those are made of many dots of which some important ones are in a different color. For non colour blind people those tests are solvable but not always at first glance. Chroma achieves a higher contrast by using gray shades for the background dots and blue shades for the number dots. This watchface is for arts lovers, design fans and dot fetishists. 

Redesign / Programming / Copyright © 2015 Sam Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: Repeating numbers are not coloured the same way anymore.

data.title: Chroma

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Quick Views.  Configuration rebuilt using Clay, so settings can be change when phone offline.
Added support for Pebble Time Round.  Requires Pebble firmware 3.8 or later.

Excelsior V2 for color Pebbles only.
For black and white Pebbles download watchface just called Excelsior.

data.description:
Excelsior 2

Version of the watchface for Pebbles with color screens.

The hour is the colored section in the saucer found in the traditional analog watch positions. 
The 10-minutes are the digital number on the left nacell (bottom left) and the additional minutes on the right nacell (bottom right).

AM/PM shown in the hour color above (AM) and below (PM) the minute digits.

There are 4 color combinations selectable in the Settings.

Version 2.1 requires Pebble firmware 3.8 or later and introduces suypport for the Pebble Time Round.
  
The screenshot examples show:  
 (1) 06:32AM orange hours/ blue minutes
 (2) 09:56PM blue hours / orange minutes
 (3) 09:58PM green hours / yellow minutes
 (4) 09:31PM red hours / orange minutes

This design was created by Peter Fletcher, from the UK, and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio.  It is published with the designer's permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design found here: 
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/05/23/wrist-wear-to-boldly-go/

A version for black and white Pebbles is also available, just called 'Excelsior'.

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Quick Views.  Configuration rebuilt using Clay, so settings can be change when phone offline.

data.description:
Use Strava? Have a Pebble? 

Then you need Streble (probably)

Weekly goal progress for cyclists and runners (without Premium) displayed right on your watch face.

Monthly and all-time statistics viewable with a shake of your wrist.

Low battery and BT disconnect icons fitted as standard.

/// NEW FEATURES IN NEXT UPDATE ///
- User selectable metric / imperial units
- More distinct BT reconnect/disconnect vibrate patterns
- Easier to read (better looking) stats

/// PLANNED FUTURE FEATURES ///
- Weather (Temperature, wind speed, rainfall)
- Timeline integration!!

changelog.release_notes:
See the time in a different way.

Instead of saying "I studied for 2 hours" say "It studied for almost 10% of my day" 

The background colour changes from green to red as the time goes past, just like a battery. And if you want to know the real time, date or weather just flick your wrist and there you go! 

And it is open source! Here is the code: https://github.com/lazaronijunior/Percentage-Watchface

data.description:
See the time in a different way.

Seeing time as a percentage you can be more aware of how much of your time you are dedicating to each thing.

The background colour changes from green to red as the time goes past, just like a battery, so you know when your day is about to finish. 

And if you want to know the time, date or weather just flick your wrist and there you go! 

Aaaand it is open source! Here is the code: https://github.com/lazaronijunior/Percentage-Watchface

changelog.release_notes:
+ choice of date format: DDMM or MMDD.

data.description:
Enigma watch face variant with more information displayed. (Colour, Digital, for Pebble Time).
Added info:
- date (includes weekday name, date in ddmm format, and year or dual time in separate rows)
- AM/PM indicated by time bar colour:
  > Red: AM,
  > Blue: PM.
- bluetooth connection & battery level indicators.
  > Battery-level indicator: orange bar (3rd column):
    * Top down: charging,
    * Bottom-up: draining.
  > Bluetooth: weekday name background:
    * Coloured: connected,
    * Black: disconnected.
v2.5 adds optional vibrations on Bluetooth disconnect and hourly vibrations (configurable period).
v2.6 adds choice of date format (in DDMM or MMDD) and dual time: a 2nd time display instead of year (in 4th row). Shake to force display update.


Modded from chadheim's old black & white example.


If you're a Star Trek or Star Wars fan, do check out my other Enigma+ Klingon/Rosetta watch face with selectable alien text =)

latest_release.release_notes:
+ choice of date format: DDMM or MMDD.
+ dual time: choice of displaying a 2nd time instead of year (in 4th row).
+ shake to force display update.

data.title: Enigma+

changelog.release_notes:
Version 1.25

- Bug fix

Version 1.24

- Center time layer when 12 hour mode is set

Version 1.23

- Make fonts bigger

Version 1.22

- Revert time layers font back to original digital font
Fixes settings page

Added more configuration settings:

- Vibrate when settings have been changed
- Option for a battery icon, icon override on charge and <= 20% battery 
- Option for a Subtle battery icon
- Option for icon on bluetooth disconnect
- Option to have vibrate on bluetooth connect/disconnect
- Option to display battery percent in top right corner
- Option to have watch vibrate on the hour or half-hour, within a set period of the day

- Added a PayPal Donate button on the settings page
Added a settings page that allows user configuration. The settings include time and date format, as well as a screen invert option.

data.description:
A simple, uncluttered, digital watchface.

Inspired by a minimalistic outdoor watch, this face displays the current time, along with the day name and date underneath. 

With it's bold digital font, it is easily seen at a glance in all lighting conditions.

The new settings page has a range of options that allow you to configure the face to meet your personal taste.

Features:

Screen Invert
- Black or white background

Time Format
- 12 or 24 hour time

Date Format
- US or international date format

Battery Icon
- Always on or only when charging
- Line bar or percentage
- Automatically displays if watch is below 20%

Bluetooth Icon
- Display when disconnected
- Can be turned off
- Icon appears in the top left corner as a small dot

Vibrate On Bluetooth Disconnect / Connect
- On or off
- Long vibration pulse on disconnect
- Double vibration pulse on connect

Hourly Vibration
- On or off
- Every hour or every 30 minutes
- Double vibration pulse on the hour
- Single vibration pulse on the half hour

Vibration Settings
- Controls when bluetooth vibration and hourly vibration are allowed
- Begin at any time
- End at any time

If you are enjoying this watchface, remember to give it a heart!

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 1.25

- Bug fix

data.description:
Minimalistic analog watchface with vortex animation every minute.
Configurable options include
- Bluetooth alert buzz strength
- Show Digital time
- Show Battery indicator
- Show Date
- Show Day of the Week
- Show Seconds
- Disable minute animation

Or reset everything and go back to original minimalistic look!

(Keep in mind that constant animation may take a toll on your battery. For longer lasting battery disable animation. For longest lasting battery disable seconds display as well)

latest_release.release_notes: - Pebble 2/Diorite support

data.description:
EgoCycle watchface displays today's personal biorhythm.

Green, red, blue and rosewood bars represent physical, emotional, intellectual and intuitive cycle respectively. The higher a bar, the stronger the person feels in that domain. Critical days are marked with a warning icon.

Enjoy!

Made with ♥ in Italy

Credits:
* Icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
* Thanks to Zed Karkar for his idea of using time of birth in addition to date of birth
* Thanks to Gilles P for his feature suggestions

Ru, Ua, En, Usr(lat+cyr)
It shows:

- calendar 
- weather in the current location or custom location: C and F, current and long-term forecasts
- connection status 
- battery status 
If you download Android app at http://pebblewatch.pw/tcw/, then you will be able to watch phone's battery status, missed calls, mail, SMS, SB notification, calendar events, Internet connection status and other.                                                      .

data.title: TCW (Time, Calendar, Weather)

data.author: Nitin Gupta

changelog.release_notes: Initial 1.0 release.

data.description:
Abstract Earth/Sun/Moon watchface. The position of the sun represents the hour hand in a traditional dial. The position of the moon represents the minute hand in a tradition dial. The moving star represents the seconds elapsed in a minute. The star will progress from top to bottom - once it reaches the bottom, the minute will update and the star will start from 0 (top).

The watchface also animates a twinkling effect every time you shake the watch or when you enter the watchface.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial 1.0 release.

data.title: Earth

data.author: Zach Burnham

changelog.release_notes: Fixed some things. Added experimental weather option that will show the weather in Fahrenheit as a minute tick. But mostly I fixed the new battery indicator option (so you can actually turn it off).
Fixed some things. Added experimental weather option that will show the weather in Fahrenheit as a minute tick. But mostly I fixed the new battery indicator option (so you can actually turn it off).
Now configurable! Have a second hand! Have bluetooth disconnect vibrations! Have a new cool, subtle way of showing the battery level!

data.description:
I modified the Thin watchface by Chris Lewis and wanted to share my take on it. The biggest changes are the more circular shape of the watchface, the red hour hand, and the minute marks showing where needed. There's also an option to show battery level as the size of the hour marks.

Now customizable! Let me know if you have any requests for further changes.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed some things. Added experimental weather option that will show the weather in Fahrenheit as a minute tick. But mostly I fixed the new battery indicator option (so you can actually turn it off).

Added choice for Celcius or Fahrenheit
Correction for temp below freezing
Added API key for weather info
Corrected text n/a during temperature load.
Improved font size for hour and some minor polishing.
Initial release

data.description: Time and temperature (in C or F) handed to you by Larry Laffer, from the classic adventure game Leisure Suit Larry. Freebie like every choice our hero Larry ever made! With compliments of Faith, Jasmine and Fawn.

latest_release.release_notes: Added Jasmine and Fawn

data.title: Leisure Suit Larry

data.author: Kiezel

changelog.release_notes: Fixed OpenWeatherMap issue
Fixed typo in weather conditions
Prevent weather underground long weather descriptions from messing up the text alignments

Added support for wunderground weather
Added support for fixed weather location

data.description:
Kiezel Watchfaces | Simply Digital 2

This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

Fully customize the top bar color, top bar weather text color, main background color, the icon color, the time text color, and change the time separator from a colon to a dot.

If you aren't getting the weather data, make sure location services is turned on for your smartphone and restart your phone.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed OpenWeatherMap issue

data.title: Simply Digital 2

data.author: Ester Sanchez

changelog.release_notes: Fixed issue with time zones in original pebble (aplite) that made the event appear always in UTC time.

- Support for Original Pebble

- Big reorganization and clean up of the code

- Fixed small issue with the battery status icon not showing always the correct battery value

- Settings: You don't need to give permission of the time to your GCalendar to access the rest of the settings

- Settings: Added setting to indicate a location or use location services from your phone

* Please note that for now you can only see events from your primary calendar. I am working in another setting to be able to select from wich calendars you want to show events but that will be in the next update.

- Fixed annoying bug changing the time of the event randomly to 01:00
- Minor stability improvements
This first version is still WIP so please don't hesitate to report bugs found! We'll try to fix them ASAP!

data.description:
CalendarCards is a watchface that displays the next event of your Google Calendar in a beautiful card as well as battery status, bluetooth conection and weather information based on your location.


Please don't forget to configure this watchface first to give it permission to read your GCalendar events.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed issue with time zones in original pebble (aplite) that made the event appear always in UTC time.

data.title: Calendar Cards
